pdhp34:1: Strive and cut off the thread, remove continuity, brahmin,
pdhp34:2: knowing the destruction of the conditioned, you are … brahmin
pdhp35:1: That one from whom one learned Dhamma, whether old or young,
pdhp35:2: with respect bow down to him, like a brahmin bows at fire-sacrifice.
pdhp36:1: That one from whom one learned Dhamma taught by the Perfect Sambuddha,
pdhp36:2: you should honor him, like a brahmin honors the fire-sacrifice.
pdhp37:1: Not because of matted hair, family or birth is one a true brahmin,
pdhp37:2: he who wards off wickedness, small or great, in every way,
pdhp37:3: through warding off wickedness, he is called a brahmin.
pdhp38:1: Like water on the lotus leaf, like a mustard seed on a needle,
pdhp38:2: he who is unsmeared by desires, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp39:1: The sun is radiant when it rises, the moon shines by night,
pdhp39:2: the accoutred noble is radiant, the meditating brahmin is radiant,
pdhp39:3: yet during every day and night the Buddha is radiant through his power.
pdhp40:1: For whom the near shore, the far shore or both do not exist,
pdhp40:2: free of fever, detached, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp41:1: When a brahmin has, through two things, crossed over,
pdhp41:2: then, for one who knows, all the fetters are laid to rest.
pdhp42:1: He who destroyed the fetter, destroyed conceit and continued existence,
pdhp42:2: living in the Community, standing by Dhamma, the knowing one does not approach society.
pdhp43:1: Whoever should speak a word of truth that is informed and is not coarse,
pdhp43:2: through which no one would be cursed, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp44:1: Whoever doesn’t mix with either householders or the houseless,
pdhp44:2: wandering homeless, with few desires, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp45:1: For whom there is no wrong-doing bodily, verbally or mentally,
pdhp45:2: being restrained in these three things, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp46:1: A brahmin should not hit a brahmin, nor should he abandon him,
pdhp46:2: woe to the one who strikes a brahmin, and to the one who does not abandon him.
pdhp47:1: Destroying mother first, and then two noble kings,
pdhp47:2: destroying a kingdom and its followers, the brahmin lives untroubled.
pdhp48:1: The deeply wise sagacious one, skilled in what is path and not path,
pdhp48:2: who has reached the ultimate good, that one I say is a brahmin.
pdhp49:1: The meditator sitting down, the one who is dustless, who has done his duty, without pollutants,
pdhp49:2: who has reached the ultimate good, that one I say is a brahmin.
